snippet: An arson attack by a Jewish extremist that killed a Palestinian toddler came on the heels of stabbings by an ultra-Orthodox Jewish man in Jerusalem’s annual Gay Pride Parade.
abstract: Attack by Israeli extremists that killed toddler and severely burned family members in West Bank village of Duma has highlighted perception that Israeli authorities are far more lenient toward Jewish perpetrators of crimes than they are toward Palestinians; attack has raised question of how to maintain democratic values in society while at same time rooting out perpetrators of extremist violence within the culture.
lead_paragraph: An arson attack by a Jewish extremist that killed a Palestinian toddler came on the heels of stabbings by an ultra-Orthodox Jewish man in Jerusalem’s annual Gay Pride Parade.

headline.main: Israeli Justice in West Bank Is Seen as Often Uneven
headline.print_headline: Israeli Justice Is Seen to Be Often Uneven
